cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.CG, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of approximating the hereditary discrepancy of a hypergraph, which is a fundamental problem in discrepancy theory. The paper uses techniques from convex geometry and linear programming, which are commonly used in the areas of algorithms and computational complexity. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.CG (Computational Geometry), and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
